Comment: I move up these pawns to give my queen and bishops room to manoeuvre...
I move up these pawns to give my queen and bishops room to manoeuvre...
I move up these pawns to give my queen and bishops room to manoeuvre...
...he develops his free bishop...
...then we trade pawns.
...then we trade pawns.
Now I bring up my queen to attack the bishop...
...so he covers it with his knight...
...so  bring out my white-square bishop to line up a potential checkmate...
...but he reads this plan by developing his queen.
So I bring up my knight to add further pressure to the bishop...
...and he develops his other knight, attacking my queen...
...and I attack his queen with my white-square bishop. Who has the stronger position in the centre: black (him) or white (me)?
He moves his queen out of the way...
...so I remove the bishop in the centre, and attack the queen again...
...he captures my knight...
...so I capture his first knight...
...followed by his second...
...followed by his second...
...and finally I develop my remaining knight.
...and finally I develop my remaining knight.
My bishop must retreat...
My bishop must retreat...
...as must its twin...
...as must its twin...
...but I put it behind my queen...
...but I put it behind my queen...
...but he moves his rook out of harm's way...
